REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Clean reversible install test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: A clean, reversible, installation allows users to successfully manage (deploy, and remove) applications on their system.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Install to the correct folders test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Windows provides specific locations in the file system to store programs and software components, shared application data, and application data specific to a user.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Digitally signed file test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: An Authenticode digital signature allows users to be sure that the software is genuine. It also allows detection if a file has been tampered with e.g. infected by a virus.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Support x64 Windows test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: To maintain compatibility with 64-bit versions of Windows, it is necessary that applications should natively support 64-bit or at minimum 32-bit Windows based applications to run seamlessly on 64-bit.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: OS version checking test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Applications must not perform version checks for equality (== 5.1). If you need a specific feature, check whether the feature is available. If you need Windows XP, check for Windows XP or later (>= 5.1), This way, your detection code will continue to work on future versions of Windows. Driver installers and uninstall modules should never check the OS version.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: User account control (UAC) test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Most applications do not require administrator privileges at run time, and should be just fine running as a standard-user. Windows applications must have a manifest (embedded or external) to define its execution level that tells OS the privileges needed to run the application.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Adhere to system restart manager messages
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: In a critical shutdown, applications that return FALSE to WM_QUERYENDSESSION will be sent WM_ENDSESSION and closed, while those that time out in response to WM_QUERYENDSESSION will be terminated.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Safe mode test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: By default, most drivers and services that did not come preinstalled with Windows are not started in Safe Mode. They should remain disabled unless they are needed for basic operations of the system or for diagnostic and recovery purposes.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Multiuser session test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Windows users should be able to run concurrent sessions without conflict or disruption. Applications must ensure that when running in multiple sessions either locally or remotely, the normal functionality of the application should not be impacted. Application settings and data files should not be persisted across users. A user’s privacy and preferences should be isolated to the user’s session.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Crashes and hangs test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Application failures such as crashes and hangs are a major disruption to users and cause frustration. Eliminating such failures improves application stability and reliability, and overall, provides users with a better application experience.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Compatibility and resiliency test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: When Windows detects that an application has operated in an incompatible manner, it applies a compatibility fix that causes the application to behave correctly, ensuring a positive user experience. Applications should not rely on this behavior since it is only provided to allow legacy applications to work correctly on Windows.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Package compliance test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: The package manifest was missing one or more required attributes.

TEST.NAME: Application count
TEST.DESCRIPTION: One package should not define more than one app in the manifest.

TEST.NAME: App manifest
TEST.DESCRIPTION: App manifest must include valid entries for all required fields.

TEST.NAME: Bundle manifest
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Bundle manifest must include valid entries for all required fields.

TEST.NAME: Package size
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Package file size should not be greater than 4 gigabytes.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Windows security best practices test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: An application should not change the default Windows security settings.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Windows security features test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Applications must opt-into Windows security features.

TEST.NAME: Binary analyzer
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Analysis of security features enabled on binaries

TEST.NAME: Banned file analyzer
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Analysis of application to detect known insecure files

TEST.NAME: Private code signing
TEST.DESCRIPTION: App should not package private code signing key files.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Supported API test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: The application should only refer to the APIs allowed by the Windows SDK for Windows Store Apps.

TEST.NAME: Supported APIs
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Windows Phone App must only use supported platform APIs.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Performance test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: The application should have a fast and responsive launch and suspend experience while consuming a reasonable amount of system resources (CPU, File IO, Memory etc.) to enable fast switching and multitasking between previously unopened applications.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: App manifest resources test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: The App Package Manifest should have valid resources defined in the resources.pri file, as per the App Packaging Specification and App Manifest Schema.

TEST.NAME: App resources validation
TEST.DESCRIPTION: The package should have valid resources defined in the resources.pri file.

TEST.NAME: Branding validation
TEST.DESCRIPTION: App should not use the default images packed by windows SDK samples or Visual Studio.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Debug configuration test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: The App should not install any debug binaries.

TEST.NAME: Debug configuration
TEST.DESCRIPTION: The App should not install any debug binaries.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: File encoding test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Packages containing an HTML5 Windows Store app must have correct file encoding.

TEST.NAME: UTF-8 file encoding
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Packages containing an HTML5 Windows Store app must have correct file encoding.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Direct3D Feature Test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: App should use the Direct3D capability correctly.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: App Capabilities test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Packages declaring special-use capabilities will have to provide justifications during the onboarding process.

TEST.NAME: Special use capabilities
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Packages declaring special-use capabilities will have to provide justifications during the onboarding process.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Windows Runtime metadata validation
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Metadata needs to be conformant and consistent across all generation sources.

TEST.NAME: ExclusiveTo attribute test
TEST.DESCRIPTION: A class must not implement an interface that is marked ExclusiveTo another class.

TEST.NAME: Type location test
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Types must be defined in the metadata file with the longest matching namespace.

TEST.NAME: Type name case-sensitivity test
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Namespace and type names must not vary only by casing.

TEST.NAME: Type name correctness test
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Only system types can be in the Windows namespace and no types can be in the global namespace.

TEST.NAME: General metadata correctness test
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Metadata files must meet various requirements in order to be valid and correct.

TEST.NAME: Properties test
TEST.DESCRIPTION: Write-only and indexer properties may not be used. Corresponding getter and setter methods must match in type.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Package sanity test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: Validation of the app package contents to ensure correctness.

TEST.NAME: Platform appropriate files
TEST.DESCRIPTION: App should not install files that do not match the target processor architecture.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: High-DPI support
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: The application needs to set DPI-aware to make the UI look consistently good across a wide variety of high-DPI display settings.

REQUIREMENT.TITLE: Resource Usage Test
REQUIREMENT.RATIONALE: WinJS background tasks need to call close() to free resource.

TEST.NAME: WinJS background task test
TEST.DESCRIPTION: WinJS background tasks need to call close() to free resource.
